alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing one or more fluorine atoms attached to a benzene ring.
alternative_parents.name: Fluorobenzenes

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing one or more chlorine atoms attached to a benzene moiety.
alternative_parents.name: Chlorobenzenes

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing the acyl fluoride functional group.
alternative_parents.name: Aryl fluorides

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing the acyl chloride functional group.
alternative_parents.name: Aryl chlorides

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing  a five-member aromatic ring of two carbon atoms and three nitrogen atoms.
alternative_parents.name: Triazoles

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing an aromatic ring where a carbon atom is linked to an hetero atom.
alternative_parents.name: Heteroaromatic compounds

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing an heterocycle with at least one oxygen atom linked to a ring carbon.
alternative_parents.name: Oxacyclic compounds

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a cyclic ether with three ring atoms(one oxygen and two carbon atoms).
alternative_parents.name: Epoxides

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing the dialkyl ether functional group, with the formula ROR', where R and R' are alkyl groups.
alternative_parents.name: Dialkyl ethers

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing an heterocycle with at least one nitrogen atom and one carbon atom linked to each other.
alternative_parents.name: Azacyclic compounds

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a bond between carbon a pnictogen atom. Pnictogens are p-block element atoms that are in the group 15 of the periodic table.
alternative_parents.name: Organopnictogen compounds

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing a nitrogen atom.
alternative_parents.name: Organonitrogen compounds

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a chemical bond between a carbon atom and a fluorine atom.
alternative_parents.name: Organofluorides

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a chemical bond between a carbon atom and a chlorine atom.
alternative_parents.name: Organochlorides

alternative_parents.description: Derivatives of hydrocarbons obtained by substituting one or more carbon atoms by an heteroatom. They contain at least one carbon atom and heteroatom.
alternative_parents.name: Hydrocarbon derivatives

class.description: Organic compounds containing a 1,2-diphenylethylene moiety. Stilbenes (C6-C2-C6 ) are derived from the common phenylpropene (C6-C3) skeleton building block. The introduction of one or more hydroxyl groups  to a phenyl ring lead to stilbenoids.
class.name: Stilbenes

description: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as stilbenes. These are organic compounds containing a 1,2-diphenylethylene moiety. Stilbenes (C6-C2-C6 ) are derived from the common phenylpropene (C6-C3) skeleton building block. The introduction of one or more hydroxyl groups  to a phenyl ring lead to stilbenoids.

direct_parent.description: Organic compounds containing a 1,2-diphenylethylene moiety. Stilbenes (C6-C2-C6 ) are derived from the common phenylpropene (C6-C3) skeleton building block. The introduction of one or more hydroxyl groups  to a phenyl ring lead to stilbenoids.
direct_parent.name: Stilbenes

kingdom.description: Compounds that contain at least one carbon atom, excluding isocyanide/cyanide and their non-hydrocarbyl derivatives, thiophosgene, carbon diselenide, carbon monosulfide, carbon disulfide, carbon subsulfide, carbon monoxide, carbon dioxide, Carbon suboxide, and dicarbon monoxide.
kingdom.name: Organic compounds

predicted_lipidmaps_terms: Diphenyl ethers, biphenyls, dibenzyls and stilbenes (PK1309)

superclass.description: Organic compounds that are synthesized either from the amino acid phenylalanine (phenylpropanoids) or the decarboxylative condensation of malonyl-CoA (polyketides). Phenylpropanoids are aromatic compounds based on the phenylpropane skeleton. Polyketides usually consist of alternating carbonyl and methylene groups (beta-polyketones), biogenetically derived from repeated condensation of acetyl coenzyme A (via malonyl coenzyme A), and usually the compounds derived from them by further condensations.
superclass.name: Phenylpropanoids and polyketides
